contentrichtext.text: <!-- Notable check article talk page. Pass WP:BK #1 --> {{Infobox animanga/Header | name = Xenon | image = | caption = | ja_kanji = 重機甲兵ゼノン | ja_romaji = Jūki Kōhē Zenon | genre = [[Action genre|Action]], [[Fantasy]], [[Science fiction]] }} {{Infobox animanga/Print | type = manga | author = [[Masaomi Kanzaki]] | publisher = [[Tokuma Shoten]] (1986)<br> [[Kodansha]] (2000) | publisher_en = {{flagicon|Canada}} {{flagicon|United States}} [[Eclipse Comics]] (1987)<br> {{flagicon|Canada}} {{flagicon|United States}} [[Viz Communications]] (1992) | demographic = ''[[Seinen manga|Seinen]]'' | magazine = [[Monthly Comic Ryū]] | first = March 1986 | last = March 1987 | volumes = 4 | volume_list = }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{nihongo|'''''Xenon'''''|重機甲兵ゼノン|Jūki Kōhē Zenon|lit. "Heavy Metal Warrior Xenon"}} (aka. Bio Diver Xenon) is a [[Japanese language|Japanese]] [[manga]] written and illustrated by [[Masaomi Kanzaki]]. The manga was published in 1986 by [[Shogakukan]] and 2000 by [[Kodansha]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kodanclub.com/cgi-local/comic.cgi?id=005-00091-01-001|title= Jyukikohei XENON (1) BIO DIVER XENON (1)|publisher=[[Kodansha]]|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> It was serialised in [[seinen]] magazine [[Monthly Comic Ryū]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2007-08-20/comic-ryu-mag-to-include-galactic-heroes-film-for-free|title=Japan's Comic Ryū to Include Free Galactic Heroes Film|date=2007-08-20|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> The manga was licensed by [[Eclipse Comics]] in 1987 and by [[Viz Communications]] in 1992. The manga is licensed for a French-language release in France by [[Génération Comics]] and Semic,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.paninicomicsfrance.com/NosCollections.jsp?Action=Carica&Id=8363|title=Xenon|publisher=[[Panini Comics]]|language=French|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.animint.com/guide/manga/fiche_167.html|title=Xenon|publisher=animint.com|language=French|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> licensed for a German-language release in Germany by [[Planet Manga]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mangaguide.de/index.php3?url=xenon|title=XENON|publisher=mangaguide.de|language =German|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> and licensed in Taiwan by [[Taiwan Tohan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.books.com.tw/exep/prod/booksfile.php?item=0010292643|title=重機甲兵捷諾 1|publisher=books.com.tw|language=Chinese|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> ==Manga== [[Kodansha]] published the manga's 4 ''[[tankōbon|bound volumes]]'' between March 1986 and March 1987.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4091506917/|title=重機甲兵ゼノン 1 (1) (少年ビッグコミックス) (新書)|publisher=[[Amazon.co.jp]]|language=Japanese|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4091506941/|title=重機甲兵ゼノン 4 (4) (少年ビッグコミックス) (新書)|publisher=[[Amazon.co.jp]]|language=Japanese|accessdate=2009-03-15}}</ref> ==Reception== {{Expand section|date=June 2010}} The French Manga-News regarded the first volume as "a good action manga if you like the author or the genre, but dispensable for others".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manga-news.com/index.php/manga/Bio-Xenon/vol-1#review|title=Bio Xenon Vol.1|publisher=manga-news.com|language=French|accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref> While praising the art, the Manga-News reviewer felt the story was unoriginal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manga-news.com/index.php/manga/Bio-Xenon/vol-2#review|title=Bio Xenon Vol.2|publisher=manga-news.com|language=French|accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref> He felt that the "non-stop action" prevented the series from sinking into caricatures,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manga-news.com/index.php/manga/Bio-Xenon/vol-3#review|title=Bio Xenon Vol.3|publisher=manga-news.com|language=French|accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref> and noted that the fanbase of the manga kept the manga going into a fourth volume, and found the last volume "most interesting".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manga-news.com/index.php/manga/Bio-Xenon/vol-4#review|title=Bio Xenon Vol.4|publisher=manga-news.com|language=French|accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref> ==References== <references/> ==External links== *{{ann|manga|2785}} [[Category:Action anime and manga]] [[Category:Fantasy anime and manga]] [[Category:1986 manga]] [[Category:Science fiction anime and manga]] [[Category:Seinen manga]] [[Category:Viz Media manga]] {{anime-stub}}
